channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Comedian Aparna Nancherla on middle-age rage
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Aparna Nancherla talks about how her rage is manifesting in middle age.

item.title: A 35-mph pitch for a strikeout, a first for Toronto Blue Jays catcher
item.description: In the 8th inning of the Blue Jays-Orioles game Tuesday, Toronto's catcher, Ali Sanchez, was on the mound. Here's what happened when he threw a 35-mph pitch.

item.title: Texas Republicans unveil a proposed redraw of House seats to boost the party
item.description: Texas Republicans have unveiled a proposed redraw of the state's congressional map that is likely to help the party pick up additional seats.

item.title: N.C. Republicans face a flurry of vetoes and a key Senate run announcement
item.description: North Carolina has a tradition of divided government, and the competition between the two parties over things like DEI, gun laws, and transgender care heated up this week.

item.title: Malnutrition centers close amid Nigerian food crisis
item.description: U.S. aid cuts have stoked the existing malnutrition crisis in northern Nigeria as treatment centers are forced to shut with the loss of U.S. support.

item.title: How ready is the U.S. for a major earthquake or tsunami?
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Kit Miyamoto, an engineer specializing in disaster recovery, about U.S. readiness following the major earthquake off the Pacific coast of Russia.

item.title: Combing the beaches for treasure that started as trash: sea glass
item.description: NPR goes on a coast-to-coast hunt for treasure hiding in plain sight. Learn about sea glass and how to find it.

item.title: Syrian ceasefire tests the loyalties of Druze communities in Golan Heights
item.description: A fragile ceasefire between Druze fighters and armed Bedouin clans in Syria hasÂ brought an uneasy pause in the violence there but a strain on Syria's interim government, and tested the loyalties of the Druze communities across the border in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.

item.title: National Transportation Safety Board meets about January's deadly midair plane crash
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board opened a three-day investigative hearing Wednesday on the January midair collision near Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport, which killed 67 people.

item.title: Podcasters who backed Trump air frustrations over handling of Epstein case
item.description: Some of the same podcasters who backed President Trump last November have grown frustrated over the handling of the Epstein case, saying officials haven't keep their word to make more details public.
